testimony.name: Bobbi Barnett
key_points: Encourages approval of City of Yes for Housing Opportunity
Supports reduction and elimination of dwelling unit factor
Believes benefits of additional affordable units outweigh concerns about increased building height
Appreciates DCP's engagement with community boards
Argues for quicker review process to address housing shortage
Urges CPC not to exempt any neighborhoods from housing obligations
Emphasizes the interconnected nature of New York City's housing market

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: There is a lot to like about the many proposals in the city of and I am particularly excited to see the reduction and elimination of the dwelling unit factor and universal affordability preference in creating more housing and more of the types of housing that our city needs.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker directly mentions the Universal Affordability Preference (UAP) as one of the proposals they are excited about.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: UAP would create new permanently rent stabilized units for those who are increasingly priced out of communities like mine.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: This quote directly discusses the UAP and its potential benefits in creating affordable housing.

quotes_indicating_discussion.text: While I have heard concerns about allowing developers additional height as a part of UAP, I believe that the benefits of additional affordable units are well worth the modest additional height that these buildings may bring.
quotes_indicating_discussion.reasoning: The speaker acknowledges potential concerns about UAP but expresses support for it, showing that they are discussing this specific element of the proposal.
